column1: By the time Argeleb came to power, the line of kings had failed in the kingdoms of [[Cardolan]] and [[Rhudaur]], so Argeleb claimed sovereignty over all of [[Arnor]]<ref name="Eriador">{{App
column3: ar(a)-]]'' as a token of this<ref>{{App
column4: North}}, note 4</ref>).  He was thus not only the seventh King of [[Arthedain]], but also the seventeenth King of [[Arnor]]. Cardolan accepted this rule but Rhudaur resisted this claim, and a captain of the [[Hill-men]] of that land formed a secret alliance with Arnor's enemy, the [[Witch-king]] of [[Angmar]]. In response, Argeleb fortified the [[Weather Hills
column5: hills]], but he was killed during a siege in the Hills in {{TA

:In the Angmar campaign of the [[The Lord of the Rings: The Battle for Middle-earth II: The Rise of the Witch-king
column2: expansion pack ''The Rise of the Witch-king'']], Argeleb comes to the aid of the struggling kingdom of Rhudaur. He arrives from the North after the player destroys the first of two fortresses, and has to be defeated for the level to pass.
